Description: Handle plate sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; on top, three female heads in profile to left (only lower part of faces remaining with added red on garments) with painted inscription; at left, two vertical framing lines; on edge of plate, stepped zigzag pattern; reserved on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 38, pl. XVIII, no. 54)
Payne 1931 / Necrocorinthia. A study of corinthian art in the archaic period (p. 164, no. 22)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 62, pl. VIII, no. 6)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 109, no. A174) (Incorrectly states CVA II, p. 17, pl. VIII, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.211) (phase 3)
